task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robotic arm.

task_long_description.overview: A robot manipulator is tasked with picking up a red cylindrical object resting on a flat table marked by blue tape. The robot must perceive, approach, and grasp the red object without disturbing the surrounding area, using a top-down strategy for manipulation. The sequence covers perception, approach, alignment, grasp, verification, and lift phases for robust pick-up.
preconditions: Red object is present on the table
Robot gripper is empty and open
Workspace is clear and robot has unobstructed access
stepwise_plan: Verify the red object is visible or scan to locate it
Detect and localize the red object precisely
Move above the red object at a safe distance
Approach with fine alignment over the red object
Lower the gripper until contact is made
Close the gripper to grasp the object
Verify object is held and raise it clear of the table
success_criteria: Red object is securely held by the gripper
Object is lifted off the table without dropping
No unintended movement of nearby objects detected
failure_and_recovery: If red object is not initially visible, retry scanning
If grasp fails or is unstable, open gripper, reposition, and retry
If object is dropped, attempt to re-localize and repeat pick-up
task_long_description.termination: When the red object is held in the gripper and raised above the table

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible.
Scan workspace to find red object if not immediately visible.
Detect and localize the red object.
Open gripper to accept the object.
Move end-effector above the red object.
Compute top-down grasp pose for red object.
Move closer and align gripper with red object.
Lower gripper until contact with red object is detected.
Close gripper to grasp the red object.
Check if red object is successfully grasped.
Raise grasped object above the table.

failure_modes: Red object not visible or occluded
Unexpected collision with table or nearby markers
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning if object not visible
Re-open gripper and readjust approach if grasp is not secure
Abort and reset sequence after repeated failures
assumptions: The red object in the frames is the intended target from the instruction
No placement is performed (frames only show pick action); step terminates after lifting
Workspace markers are not involved in pick constraints

expected_success_criteria: Red object is held by gripper and lifted from table
